info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 16 at 10:57PM PST until November 17 at 2:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Line of intense storms will bring heavy rainfall to the Pickett Fire Burn Scar for the next two hours (1AM PST 17 November 2025). Flooding is likely with the potential for flash flooding to occur if particularly intense rain rates occur. The main band of rain will reach the Pickett Fire Burn Scar shortly with flooding to occur as rain rates intensify.
* WHERE...Pickett Fire Burn Scar in Napa County.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in flooding and the potential for flash flooding if particularly intense rain rates occur. This product may be upgraded depending on observed rain rates. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mainly rural areas of West Central Napa County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PST MONDAY
